name: woodcutter
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone whose job is to cut down trees and branches for wood: The woodcutter lived in a hut in a clearing in the forest.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the story, a woodcutter rescues Red Riding Hood with his axe.Until 1905, the canyon was known only to a few local woodcutters who descended into it on ropes to cut boxwood.They struggled to survive on $2 a day as woodcutters, and would have preferred farming but had no water for irrigation.The son of a forest woodcutter, he grew up in the Swedish countryside. Two woodcutters brought down a towering oak tree.
